page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY cont'd
page.content: Sometime after 1244 the monastery was built. Patronage continued under Duncans son Nigel and the de Brus family when they acquired the earldom through marriage. The future king Robert the Bruce made his first recorded official appearance as a teenager at Crossraguel as witness to a charter granted by his father. In 1404 king Robert the Third signed the great Crossraguel charter giving the Abbot eternal control over the abbey lands with judgement over rape,murder, and robbery.The monks had their own mills, brewhouses and fishings in the river Girvan. During the Reformation the protection of the Earls of Cassilis allowed the abbey to remain occupied till 1592. In 1689 the remaining buildings and revenues were annexed by the crown.
